aws_kinesis_video_stream.description: Provides a AWS Kinesis Video Stream

name.description: A name to identify the stream. This is unique to the

data_retention_in_hours.description: The number of hours that you want to retain the data in the stream. Kinesis Video Streams retains the data in a data store that is associated with the stream. The default value is `0`, indicating that the stream does not persist data.

device_name.description: The name of the device that is writing to the stream. **In the current implementation, Kinesis Video Streams does not use this name.**

kms_key_id.description: The ID of the AWS Key Management Service (AWS KMS

media_type.description: The media type of the stream. Consumers of the stream can use this information when processing the stream. For more information about media types, see [Media Types][2]. If you choose to specify the MediaType, see [Naming Requirements][3] for guidelines.

tags.description: A map of tags to assign to the resource.

arn.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the Stream (same as `id`)

creation_time.description: A time stamp that indicates when the stream was created.
